Located in Pueblo, this exclusive collection features sophisticated 1-bedroom penthouses starting from just €299,500, combining modern design with Mediterranean coastal living. With completion scheduled for 01-04-2026, BOTIRA STAR offers exceptional value in a rapidly growing area that maintains authentic Spanish character while attracting an increasingly international community of discerning buyers. This is the ideal purchase for investors seeking strong rental yields of €700 per week and owner-occupiers who want to embrace the Costa Blanca lifestyle without the premium prices of nearby Jávea.

locationSection.intro: Guardamar del Segura's Pueblo district offers an enchanting blend of traditional Spanish culture and modern coastal convenience. Nestled between the Mediterranean Sea and the Segura River marshlands, this picturesque town provides a more authentic experience than overdeveloped Torrevieja, yet maintains excellent infrastructure and amenities. The area is experiencing significant growth with an influx of British and Scandinavian residents seeking genuine Spanish heritage combined with reliable services. Guardamar is renowned for its pristine Blue Flag beaches, excellent healthcare facilities, and proximity to world-class golf courses. The town offers a perfect balance for those seeking a Mediterranean retreat with genuine community spirit, strong property appreciation potential, and access to all essential services within minutes.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You do not require a Spanish visa specifically for property purchase. Most buyers work with Spanish lawyers and tax advisors to complete the process smoothly. ALTECO INVEST and local professionals can guide you through the legal requirements and documentation needed.

faqs.question: What are the main costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Primary costs include transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (approximately 1%), land registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal fees (0.5-1%). In Alicante, you'll typically pay around 8-10% additional costs on top of the purchase price. Budget planning is essential and professional advisors are recommended.
